channel.title: World News - Breaking international news and headlines | Sky News

image.title: World News - Breaking international news and headlines | Sky News

channel.description: The latest international news from Sky, featuring top stories from around the world and breaking news, as it happens.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2021, Sky UK. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Ukraine would win war faster if it could fire British weapons into Russia, head of navy says
item.description: Ukraine would win the war faster if it had permission to fire British and other Western weapons against targets deep inside Russia, the head of the Ukrainian navy has signalled.

item.title: UN agency chief 'shocked' as nine countries pause funding over claims staff involved in Hamas attack
item.description: The head of the UN refugee agency for Palestinians (UNRWA) has said the decision by nine countries to pause funding for the aid agency is "shocking".

media:description.#text: Palestinians arrive in Rafah after fleeing an Israeli ground and air offensive in Khan Younis, 26 January, 2024. Pic: AP

item.title: 'Her stomach was out in open air': Mysterious rise in baby deaths from 'guts on the outside' condition
item.description: There was only one passenger strapped in the back of the bush plane. She said little during the flight and wore a look that revealed nothing about her ordeal.

item.title: World's largest cruise ship sets sail
item.description: The world's largest cruise ship has begun its maiden voyage.

media:description.#text: Icon of the Seas runs nearly 1,200ft (365m) from bow to stern. Pic: AP

item.title: UK-US strikes against Houthis were a gamble - but they appear to be backfiring
item.description: The Houthi attack on an oil tanker off the coast of Yemen is a significant escalation suggesting the British-American strategy to deter and degrade the Houthi threat is failing.

media:description.#text: The British-owned Marlin Luanda oil tanker on fire in the Gulf of Aden after being hit by a Houthi missile. Pic: Indian Navy

item.title: More heartbreak for 'The Nuke' - Littler loses Dutch Darts Masters final
item.description: Michael van Gerwen has denied young sensation Luke Littler a second successive World Series title after defeating him in the Dutch Darts Masters final.

media:description.#text: Luke Littler of England concentrates during the final match against Luke Humphries of England at the World Darts Championship, in London, Wednesday, Jan. 3, 2024. (AP Photo/Kin Cheung)

item.title: Trump to pay $83.3m for defaming E Jean Carroll - as he brands case a 'witch hunt'
item.description: Donald Trump has been ordered to pay $83.3m (£65.5m) in a defamation case against a woman he was found liable for sexually assaulting - with the former US president branding it all a "witch hunt".

media:description.#text: Former U.S. President Donald Trump gestures to his supporters, as he departs for his second civil trial after E. Jean Carroll accused Trump of raping her decades ago, outside a Trump Tower in the Manhattan borough of New York City, U.S., January 25, 2024. REUTERS/Eduardo Munoz

item.title: Shipping firm halts travel through the Red Sea after oil tanker hit in Houthi attack
item.description: An oil tanker caught fire after a missile attack by Houthi fighters based in Yemen.

media:description.#text: The Marlin Luanda on fire. Pic: @FFEAU_ALINDIEN/X

item.title: RAF jets flying 3,000 miles for Houthi strikes as aircraft carriers stay in UK - here's why | Sean Bell
item.description: Four British fighter jets attacked a series of Houthi targets in Yemen after taking off from RAF Akrotiri in Cyprus on Monday.

media:description.#text: For Sean Bell piece on Royal Navy carrier strike groups. Pic: Sky News Graphic

item.title: Who is the Holocaust survivor among ICJ judges in South Africa vs Israel case?
item.description: A Holocaust survivor was on the panel of judges in the International Court of Justice - voting in favour of two of the measures in the case South Africa brought against Israel.

media:description.#text: Aharon Barak, pictured in November, sits in front of images of some of the hostages taken by Hamas on 7 October. Pic: Reuters
